basics.name: Alex Ruzzarin
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer specializing in frontend development with a decade-long track record of delivering impactful solutions. Proficient in modern JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, and Angular, I've led teams in architecting robust frontend architectures and seamlessly integrating with backend services. Skilled in automation and deployment, I've streamlined development processes for enhanced efficiency. Committed to continuous learning and staying abreast of industry trends. Dev Ex advocate!
basics.about-me:
I am a knowledgeable and professional software engineer with almost 20 years of experience in the area. 
My first contact with a programming language was at age 13 when I discovered that I could automate things on IRC using mIRC Scripting. I then learned HTML and Perl + CGI, which I used to create my first website. I followed this with Javascript and CSS, as well as PHP when it became popular in the early 2000s. 
I also developed an interest in electronics during high school when I learned to program micro-controllers. I started the Electronic Engineering major at the university, but after taking some courses, I realized electronics are more of a hobby of mine. My true passion is programming. 
I got my first job as a .Net developer in 2007 and since then have obtained a wide variety of experience and skills: from mastering front-end frameworks to developing a deep understanding of DNS to support Argentinian ccTLD, with a lot of fancy technical terms learned in between (Sharepoint, .Net, Silverlight, MVVM, TDD, BDD, SQL and NoSQL, Web Services, OAuth, CI, CD, etc.). 
In 2014, I began to focus my career on front-end development. I studied frameworks like React and Vue and combined them with my previous knowledge to help my teams create better front-end architectures. Together we seamlessly integrated with the back-end services and automated everything, from build to production deployment, ensuring a less stressful and more effective development experience for the team. 
I helped making USA healthcare more accessible.
